The argument against dlc in most AAA games is that they cut away features prior release that would have been in the original game. dlc/expansions released and developed post-release is acceptable, because your paying for the devs to carry on working after release to produce more content.

Unfortunately many features are cut at release in Elite Dangerous, but they will be developed after that as free updates, not DLC. Planetary landings and walking around have always been planned as post-release expansions.
and that's fine. Most people's problem with dlc is when dev's create content before release but then make you pay extra for it. (like day 1 dlc's).
